channel.title: CVE Feed for Advantech -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Advantech -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-4202|2024-10-10T17:49:00.238Z -- advantech -- eki-1524
item.description: Advantech EKI-1524, EKI-1522, EKI-1521 devices through 1.21 are affected by a Stored Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability, which can be triggered by authenticated users in the device name field of the web-interface.

item.title: CVE-2023-4203|2024-10-10T17:46:07.494Z -- advantech -- eki-1524
item.description: Advantech EKI-1524, EKI-1522, EKI-1521 devices through 1.21 are affected by a Stored Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability, which can be triggered by authenticated users in the ping tool of the web-interface.

item.title: CVE-2024-38308|2024-09-27T17:28:34.284Z -- advantech -- adam%205550
item.description: Advantech ADAM 5550's web application includes a "logs" page where all the HTTP requests received are displayed to the user. The device doesn't correctly neutralize malicious code when parsing HTTP requests to generate page output.

item.title: CVE-2024-37187|2024-09-27T17:25:52.630Z -- advantech -- adam%205550
item.description: Advantech ADAM-5550 share user credentials with a low level of encryption, consisting of base 64 encoding.

item.title: CVE-2024-39275|2024-09-27T17:38:20.408Z -- advantech -- adam-5630
item.description: Cookies of authenticated Advantech ADAM-5630 users remain as active valid cookies when a session is closed. Forging requests with a legitimate cookie, even if the session was terminated, allows an unauthorized attacker to act with the same level of privileges of the legitimate user.

item.title: CVE-2024-28948|2024-09-27T17:42:15.478Z -- advantech -- adam-5630
item.description: Advantech ADAM-5630 contains a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability. It allows an attacker to partly circumvent the same origin policy, which is designed to prevent different websites from interfering with each other.

item.title: CVE-2024-34542|2024-09-27T17:45:02.820Z -- advantech -- adam-5630
item.description: Advantech ADAM-5630 shares user credentials plain text between the device and the user source device during the login process.

item.title: CVE-2024-39364|2024-09-27T17:48:22.902Z -- advantech -- adam-5630
item.description: Advantech ADAM-5630 has built-in commands that can be executed without authenticating the user. These commands allow for restarting the operating system, rebooting the hardware, and stopping the execution. The commands can be sent to a simple HTTP request and are executed by the device automatically, without discrimination of origin or level of privileges of the user sending the commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-39364|2024-09-27T18:13:38.784Z -- advantech -- adam-5630
item.description: Advantech ADAM-5630 has built-in commands that can be executed without authenticating the user. These commands allow for restarting the operating system, rebooting the hardware, and stopping the execution. The commands can be sent to a simple HTTP request and are executed by the device automatically, without discrimination of origin or level of privileges of the user sending the commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-34542|2024-09-27T18:07:43.370Z -- advantech -- adam-5630
item.description: Advantech ADAM-5630 shares user credentials plain text between the device and the user source device during the login process.

item.title: CVE-2024-28948|2024-09-27T18:17:57.040Z -- advantech -- adam-5630
item.description: Advantech ADAM-5630 contains a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability. It allows an attacker to partly circumvent the same origin policy, which is designed to prevent different websites from interfering with each other.

item.title: CVE-2024-39275|2024-09-27T18:14:05.172Z -- advantech -- adam-5630
item.description: Cookies of authenticated Advantech ADAM-5630 users remain as active valid cookies when a session is closed. Forging requests with a legitimate cookie, even if the session was terminated, allows an unauthorized attacker to act with the same level of privileges of the legitimate user.

item.description: Advantech ADAM-5550 share user credentials with a low level of encryption, consisting of base 64 encoding.
